intro: Melandrium weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Melandrium weberbaueri is often found in mountainous regions and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
